snippet: Three lawyers sent a letter asking that the beeping from long-range acoustic devices, called a deterrent function, not be used until the police had fully tested it.
abstract: Lawyers Gideon O Oliver, Elena Cohen and Mark D Taylor object to New York Police Department's use of long-range acoustic device during Times Square protests that followed grand jury decision not to bring charges in death of Eric Garner; send letter to Police Commissioner William J Bratton asking that devices, which emit noise blasts up to 152 decibels, not be used for deterrent purposes until police fully test it.
lead_paragraph: Three lawyers sent a letter asking that the beeping from long-range acoustic devices, called a deterrent function, not be used until the police had fully tested it.

headline.main: Concerns Raised Over Shrill Device New York Police Used During Garner Protests
headline.print_headline: Lawyers Raise Concerns Over Shrill Device Used by Police During Protests
